dc:description:
ACTN2 was first reported in association with autosomal dominant hypertrophic cardiomyopathy in humans in 2006 (Theis et al, 2006, PMID 17097056), dilated cardiomyopathy in 2010 (Zimmerman et al, 2010, PMID 20474083), arrhythmias in 2010 (Chiu et al, 2010, PMID 20022194), left ventricular noncompaction in 2014 (Bagnall et al, 2014, PMID 25224718), restrictive cardiomyopathy in 2016 (Kostareva et al, 2016, PMID 27662471), and left-dominant arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy in 2020 (Good et al, 2020, PMID 31956495). Cardiac phenotypes are associated with both gain and loss of function ACTN2 variants and do not always fit well into classical cardiomyopathy diagnosis. Individuals can show variable combinations of hypertrophy, dilatation, hyper/hypo contractility, and arrhythmias – where the phenotype can vary between individuals in the same family. A study found that patients with ACTN2 presented with varying degrees and types of arrhythmias, including left bundle branch block, atypical flutter, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation or supraventricular tachycardia, as well as atrial, ventricular, or supraventricular premature beats (Ranta-aho et al, 2022, PMID 36116040). 
 
In 2019, variants in ACTN2 were also reported in association with skeletal muscle myopathies (Savarese et al., PMID 30900782; Lornage et al., PMID 30701273). Clinical features reported in individuals with ACTN2-related skeletal myopathy include progressive distal and/or proximal muscle weakness, gait disturbance, muscle atrophy, and elevated creatine kinase (Iruzubieta et al., 2025, PMID 39812845). Inoue et al. (2021) (PMID 34471957) also report a homozygous missense variant in 4 patients from 3 unrelated families with muscle weakness and signs of muscle pathology, only 1 of whom had cardiac features. In addition, Lindholm et al. (2021) (PMID 34802252) report a homozygous premature truncating variant in a patient with cardiac disease. Respiratory insufficiency, facial weakness, contractures, and loss of ambulation have also been reported in more severe cases. Disease onset varies from early neonatal onset to adulthood. Signs on muscle pathology vary but may include fibre size variation, internalized nuclei, myofibrillar disorganization, type 1 fibre predominance, small cores, and other signs of structural disorganization. Cardiac involvement has been reported in a minority of cases. ACTN2 variants reported in association with skeletal myopathy include missense, in frame deletion, canonical splice, and C-terminal frameshift variants that result in protein extension (PMID 30900782, 30701273, 39812845; Ranta-Aho et al, 2024, PMID 39095936).
Lornage et al. (2019) (PMID 30701273) created zebrafish expressing a mutant form of ACTN2 with a patient-identified missense variant, which showed locomotion defects and disordered skeletal muscle architecture. Mice expressing the same variant also showed abnormal Z-line organization in skeletal muscle as well as muscle weakness. A skeletal muscle case from 2024 (Donkervoort et al, 2024, PMID 38311799), included a recurring homozygous missense variant in ACTN2, this variant causes a recessive myopathy, and patients presented with asymmetric, progressive, proximal and distal lower extremity weakness. Another skeletal muscle case from 2019 (Savarese et al, 2019, PMID 30900782) showed 4 different families where 3 Spanish families presented with a heterozygous ACTN2 missense variant, and 1 Swedish family presented with a different heterozygous ACTN2 missense variant. The evidence for the gene disease relationship for ACTN2 suggests an autosomal dominant pattern of inheritance but there are some cases of recessive inheritance. The disease mechanism is currently unclear and may be variant-specific since some variants have been shown to result in protein aggregation while others do not have this effect (PMID 39095936). However, gain of function or dominant-negative effects are most likely; haploinsufficiency is not an established mechanism for ACTN2-related skeletal myopathy.
 
This gene is thus associated with a phenotypic spectrum of cardiomyopathies, arrhythmias, and skeletal muscle myopathies. There is currently insufficient evidence to split these presentations based on mode of inheritance, phenotype, or disease mechanism. Per criteria outlined by the ClinGen Lumping and Splitting Working Group, all disease entities have been lumped into one inclusive disease entity, which is now being called ACTN2-related cardiac and skeletal myopathy. The inheritance pattern is primarily autosomal dominant, though at least three cases with homozygous variants have been reported (Lindholm et al, 2021, PMID 30701273; Inoue et al, 2021, PMID 34471957; Donkervoort et al, 2024, PMID 38311799).

In summary, there is definitive evidence to support the relationship between ACTN2 and ACTN2-related cardiac and skeletal myopathy. This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both the research and clinical diagnostic settings and has been upheld over time. Based on curated literature, this gene can cause seemingly isolated left ventricular hypertrophy. This classification of ACTN2 for intrinsic cardiomyopathy (HCM and DCM) was originally approved by the ClinGen Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Gene Curation Expert Panel on April 10, 2018. It was reevaluated on May 10, 2023, and expanded to include LVNC, RCM, and ACM. As a result of this re-evaluation, the classification changed from moderate to definitive due to new evidence in the literature. This current curation was done on December 11, 2024, and expanded to include skeletal muscle myopathies in the phenotypic spectrum associated with variation in ACTN2.

evidence.dc:description: This proband has a missense variant, Thr247Met, that is likely pathogenic in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

hiPSCs and CRISPR/Cas9 gene editing were used to model a novel ACTN2 missense mutation in an HCM‐affected family and showed that HCM hiPSC‐CMs recapitulated known hallmarks of HCM such as myofibrillar disarray, cell hypertrophy, increased myofilament Ca2+ sensitivity, hypercontractility, and prolonged relaxation.

This proband has a nonsense variant, Glu849Ter, that is absent in ClinVar. This variant is located in the last exon of the gene, and thus would not be expected to undergo NMD, so the score has been reduced. This variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.
This proband has a missense variant, Met228Thr, that is likely pathogenic in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, Glu583Ala, with conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 5/113734 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.00004396, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1.
This proband has a missense variant, Val115Met, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, p.Arg298His, with conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity in ClinVar. MAF=0.0008213, in 106/129066 European (NF) alleles with 1 homozygote in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband received a reduced score due to MAF being too high.

This proband is homozygous for a truncating variant, Gln860Ter, that is pathogenic in ClinVar. This variant is located in the last exon of ACTN2, so it received reduced points. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.
Patient-derived hiPSC cardiomyocytes displayed contractile dysfunction and hypertrophy. NRVMs with ACTN knocked down also exhibited marked hypertrophy.
This proband has a missense variant, Arg759Thr, that is pathogenic in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

•  Nontruncating variants OR: 0.58 (0.30-1.12)
•  Truncating variants OR: 7.00 (0.84-58.17)
Scoring 0 pts due to cases and controls not being matched demographically, OR that crosses 1.0, and low statistical significance upon Fishers exact 2-sided test.

controlCohort.detectionMethod: Variants associated with HCM were identified based on manual curation of the HGMD disease terms. The total allele frequency and count from ExAC were extracted for each variant. Polymorphisms (ExAC MAF >1 × 10−2) were removed from the analysis. The number of HGMD variants present in ExAC was calculated at any frequency and with MAF >1 × 10−4.

evidence.dc:description: Scoring 2 points given the OR of aggregate variants and because there was statistical significance shown by excess after Bonferroni multiple testing correction. However, cases and controls were not matched demographically or by genetic ancestry.

caseCohort.detectionMethod:
Careggi University Hospital: Sequenced on a panel comprising 111 genes implicated in cardiomyopathies (N=27), and those tested later (N=5) sequenced on the 174-genes 

LMM: sequenced, non-specific

29447731: Up to 66 genes were sequenced in each case

30471092: Sequenced on a 107 gene cardiomyopathy and arrhythmia panel

28798025: Exome sequencing, with variant details for 104 cardiac genes

18506004, 21551322, 23768516: did not sequence ACTN2

controlCohort.detectionMethod: Rare variants were defined as having a filtering allele frequency (FAF) in gnomAD exomes (v 2.1) less than 0.0001 for both the popmax FAF and the overall FAF

evidence.dc:description:
Includes data from Girolami 2014; PMID: 25173926, Chiu 2010; PMID: 20022194, and Theis 2006; PMID: 17097056.
Scoring 0 since this study contains information from other studies in this curation in addition to the lack of matching between cases and controls.

caseCohort.detectionMethod: Sequencing of 31 genes implicated in HCM

controlCohort.detectionMethod: Sequencing of 31 genes implicated in HCM

evidence.dc:description: This proband has a 4.3 kb deletion of exons 8 through 10. This proband received a reduced score since some (20%) protein product is still made.
Patient-derived hiPSC cardiomyocytes displayed contractile dysfunction, hypertrophy, and sarcomeric structural disarray.
Only 3 segregations
evidence.rdfs:label: ALB

member.rdfs:label: Bagnall III-5
member.phenotypeFreeText: LVmax=6mm, PW=4mm, LVEDD=51mm, ST-T wave changes on ECG, implantable cardioverter-defibrillator,

member.rdfs:label: Fan Proband II-5
member.phenotypeFreeText: Syncope during farm work. B ultrasonic testing showed enlargement of the left ventricle and left atrium (65 and 47 mm, respectively; normal values: <50 and <28 mm, respectively) (Fig. 1B). The ECG records indicated ventricular tachycardia ( Fig. 1 C). Case history analysis revealed that she had been hospitalized twice in this year due to heart palpitations. IVS=8m, LVPW=9mm, RA=27mm, LA=47mm, RV=21mm, LV=65mm, AO=25mm, PA=17mm, FS=33%, EF=57%

evidence.dc:description: 48 disease genes for HCM, selected on the basis of published reports, were analyzed by targeted resequencing with a customized enrichment system
evidence.rdfs:label: Italian family

member.rdfs:label: II-15
member.detectionMethod: 48 disease genes for HCM were analyzed by NGS.
member.phenotypeFreeText: Mild, asymmetrical LV hypertrophy localized to the basal and midseptum, marked biatrial dilatation, and a restrictive LV filling pattern with preserved systolic function. History of paroxysmal AF that presented at the age of 30, which subsequently evolved into permanent AF with advanced AV block, requiring VVI pacing at the age of 68. New York Heart Association class II.
member.previousTestingDescription: Direct clinical assessment and genetic testing were performed in 18 subjects including the proband. Available family members were assessed by clinical examination, ECG, echocardiography, and 24-hour Holter monitoring, performed blinded to (and often before) genetic testing.

member.rdfs:label: Lindholm Proband Del 1
member.detectionMethod: Clinical panel genetic sequencing for genes associated with cardiomyopathy (GeneDx). 4.3 kb deletion of exons 8 through 10 and was also found to have a 41bp insertion in intron 10: ACTN2(NM_001103.3):c.698-128_1107+261delins1108-1302_1108-1262; confirmed with Sanger, also has a VUS in PDLIM3 (p.Thr4Met).
member.phenotypeFreeText: Exertional syncope, repolarization abnormalities in inferior and anterolateral leads (Fig. 1C). An echo and cardiac MRI showed normal biventricular function with borderline wall thinning in the posterior wall (diastolic thickness Z score -3.14), no delayed enhancement nor fatty infiltration. A cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) was implanted.

member.rdfs:label: El II:1
member.detectionMethod: Linkage analysis revealed a max LOD score of 2.82 at θ=0 for D1S2850. The 5.7Mb critical region included 38 genes, with 2 candidates, ryanodine receptor (RYR2) and ACTN2. Of note, only 37 of the 106 exons in the RyR2 gene were screened (exons 7 to 9, 13 to 16, 43 to 50, and 83 to 106).
member.phenotypeFreeText: Progression to severe HF. LV max=15mm, PW=19mm, LVESD=36mm, LVEDD=42mm, FS=14%
member.previousTestingDescription: Previous negative sequencing results for MYH7, MYBPC3, MYL2, MYL3, TNNT2, TNNI3, TPM1, ACTC, PLN, and CSRP3

evidence.dc:description: This proband has a nonsense variant, Arg192Ter, with MAF=0.00002891 in 1/34592 Latino/Admixed American alleles and 0 homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. Patient also has VUS variants in TAZ (c.29C>G p.P10R), CBL (c.805A>G p.M269V) and a LP variant in TAZ (c.355G>A p.V119M; hemizygous). This variant is down-scored since TAZ is definitively associated with Barth Syndrome which has cardiac phenotypes.
This proband has a missense variant, Leu223Pro, that is absent from ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.
This proband has a missense variant, Gly111Val, of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

Expression of mEos2-tagged ACTN2 p.Gly111Val in adult rat cardiomyocytes results in aberrant integration and exchange into Z discs, and tendency for the mutant to form aggregates outside the Z-discs (Haywood et al, 2016, PMID 27287556). Not in ExAC.
This proband has a small deletion, Leu70del.
This proband has a missense variant, Asp816Asn, with conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. MAF=0.00006152, in 1/16254 African/African American alleles with 0 homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1

This proband is compound heterozygous, phase unknown, with another variant in ACTN2, c.2194G>A (p.Ala732Thr), which has conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 8/113766 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.00007032, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1.
This proband has a missense variant, Tyr473Cys, of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, p.Ala644Thr, with conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity in ClinVar. MAF=0.0003101, in 40/128992 European (NF) alleles with 0 homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband received a reduced score due to the MAF being too high and the presence of a pathogenic variant in MYH7 (c.2155C>T p.R719W) and a LP variant in TNNT2 (c.857G>A p.R286H).

This proband has a missense variant, Thr495Met, with conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 58/129130 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.0004492, with 1 homozygote in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is scored reduced points since there is a homozygote present in gnomAD.

This proband has a frameshift variant, Asp841IlefsTer60, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. It is unknown if haploinsufficiency, resulting from the frameshift variant, is a disease mechanism for ACTN2. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, Asn175Tyr, that is not in ClinVar, but is classified as likely pathogenic based on this publication's use of the ACMG guidelines. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, Thr495Met, with conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 58/129130 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.0004492, with 1 homozygote in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is scored reduced points since there is a homozygote present in gnomAD.

This proband has a second variant in ACTN2, Pro856Leu, that has conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 4/24960 African American alleles at a frequency of 0.0001603, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband received a reduced score due to MAF being too high.

This proband has a missense variant, His775Tyr, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 3/113764 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.00002637, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a nonsense variant, Arg192Ter, with a MAF=0.00002891 in 1/34592 Latino/Admixed American alleles and 0 homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. Patient also has a VUS variant in EYA4 (c.971-3T>C) and MYLK2 (c.425G>T p.G142V).
This proband has a missense variant, Glu628Gly, that is pathogenic in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, Ala119Thr, that is pathogenic in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is scored reduced points because it appears that they are related to family EI based on the haplotype analysis.
This proband has a missense variant, Glu583Ala, with conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity in ClinVar. MAF=0.00004396, in 5/113734 European (NF) alleles with 0 homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1.
This proband has a missense variant, Ala119Thr, that is pathogenic in ClinVar. The variant is absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.
Expression of p.Ala119Thr in C2C12 (mouse myoblast) cells resulted in a significant increase in RNA markers of hypertrophy (ACTA1 and BNP).

This proband has a missense variant, Asn529Ser, with conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 11/19954 East Asian alleles at a frequency of 0.0005513, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is scored reduced points due to the MAF being too high.
This proband has a 9.3kb intragenic deletion of exons 3-6. Haplotype is shared with family CKE that has HCM, suggesting a common ancestor.

This proband has a missense variant, Leu320Arg, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 2/18394 East Asian alleles at a frequency of 0.0001087, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is scored reduced points due to the MAF being too high. The proband also has variants in TTN (p.L9554F), MYL3 (p.V156L), TP63 (p.Q346E), CACNA2D1 (c.355-4delTT), VCL (p.P840R), and RBM20 (p.R380Q) but none are P/LP in ClinVar.
This proband has a nonsense variant, Trp388Ter, that is absent in ClinVar. The variant is also absent in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, Ser433Leu, that is benign/likely benign in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 228/24966 African/African American alleles at a frequency of 0.009132, with 1 homozygote in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is scored reduced points since there is a homozygote present in gnomAD, the frequency is too high and there is a pathogenic variant in TNNC1, c.23 C>T.

This proband has a missense variant, His775Tyr, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 3/113764 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.00002637, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1.

This proband has a missense variant, Thr495Met, with conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 58/129130 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.0004492, with 1 homozygote in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is scored reduced points since there is a homozygote present in gnomAD.

This proband has a missense variant, Gln9Arg, with conflicting interpretations in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 135/116270 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.001161, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is scored reduced points due to the high MAF.

This proband has a missense variant, Asp857His, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 6/113492 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.00005287, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1.
Northern blot analysis of adult mouse mRNA showed ACTN2 is highly expressed in heart muscle, and also in skeletal muscle, where it localizes to Z discs (Haywood et al, 2016, PMID  27287556).
evidence.rdfs:label: ACTN2 Northern blot

evidence.dc:description: Variants in SCN5A identified in various cardiac phenotypes including atrial fibrillation, Brugada syndrome, DCM, LQTS, ventricular fibrillation. Patients with ACTN2 variants have been noted to have cardiac arrhythmias.
evidence.rdfs:label: ACTN2-SCN5A interaction

evidence.dc:description: Interacts with CSRP3, encoding muscle LIM protein (MLP) as shown by blot overlay assay (Louis et al, 2007; PMID 9341203) and GST pull down (Vafiadaki et al, 2014; 24860983). CSRP3 has a definitive ClinGen clinical validity classification for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.
evidence.rdfs:label: ACTN2-CSRP3 interaction

evidence.dc:description: The gene product of ACTN2, alpha-actinin 2, has multiple functions that are consistent with the hypertrophic cardiomyopathy disease process including acting as a structural anchor, stretch sensor, signaling node, and in ion channel organization. Disruption of these functions could result in myocardial disarray, left ventricular dysfunction, hypertrophic response, and arrhythmia respectively.
evidence.rdfs:label: Review of ACTN2 function

evidence.dc:description: Compared to ACTN2wt, ACTN2mut hiPSC-CMs exhibited (i) cellular hypertrophy, myofibrillar disarray, multinucleation, ACTN2 protein aggregation, and activation of both the UPS and ALP in 2D culture, (ii) a marked reduction in the levels of sarcomere-associated proteins in 2D and EHTs, and (iii) force impairment in EHTs. These findings indicate impaired sarcomerogenesis and proteopathy as typical features in ACTN2mut.
evidence.rdfs:label: ACTN2 hiPSC-CM Functional Alteration

evidence.dc:description: Rescue supports evidence from morpholino knockdown - i.e. LOF mechanism, where as virtually all variants scored are missense. More representative of DCM than HCM, with ventricular dilation. Additionally, zebrafish are not good models for cardiomyopathies. However, rescue of the phenotype was convincing evidence for the experts to score this at the default.

When zebrafish actn2 mRNA was coinjected along with the exon2-intron2 MO, up to 30% of fry were rescued and developed with normal gross morphology. Individual measurements of morphant length, somite number, and heart rate confirmed that all these aspects were largely rescued by actn2 mRNA, but not by actn3 mRNA.
evidence.rdfs:label: Rescue in zebrafish morpholino model

evidence.dc:description: In summary, the heterozygous mouse model (in mature male mice) supports a pathological role of the ACTN2 p.Met228Thr variant but provides little insight into the disease mechanisms. Differences in physiology between humans and mice, the relatively young age of the mice and lack of stressors might explain this lack of an overt phenotype.

In summary, the heterozygous mouse model (in mature male mice) supports a pathological role of the ACTN2 p.Met228Thr variant but provides little insight into the disease mechanisms. Differences in physiology between humans and mice, the relatively young age of the mice and lack of stressors might explain this lack of an overt phenotype.
evidence.rdfs:label: ACTN2 Mouse Model
